question: What is the name of the mission undertaken by the Indian Navy, to bring back Indian citizens from overseas during the COVID-19 pandemic?
explanation:
The Indian Navy has successfully completed its mission named ‘Operation Samudra Setu’, to bring back Indian citizens from overseas during the COVID-19 pandemic.
It was launched in May 2020 and since then, the Indian Naval Ships Jalashwa, Airavat, Shardul and Magar were deployed in the 55-day operation to bring back 3,992 Indian citizens via sea. Indian navy had arranged proper sanitation measures and medical facilities in the ships to avoid contraction of the virus by passengers.
